website_summaries.verdict: An excellent low-cost kit for the DIY enthusiast.
pros: You get driver, battery, charger, and bag for the price of some standalone tools
cons: The supplied 1.5-amp hour battery limits run time

customer_reviews.title: Purchased and broke on my the first time I used it
customer_reviews.text: Hi, I purchased this drill a few months ago for an upcoming project in the future. Started the project earlier today which was just drilling some screws into a flange then into some wood. got 6/8 screws in and then the drill will no longer spin for more then 2 seconds at a time and the output is very weak. Thought maybe it was the battery, charged the battery to full and this is still happening. I wasted a lot of money on this drill and now I can't use it. I would be willing to give it another shot if I could do an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Burg

customer_reviews.title: It's amazing. I and sticking with DeWalt so I can ...
customer_reviews.text: For years I've put lumber together with a "good ole fashioned" battery powered electric screwdriver. In fact, I purchased the DeWalt screwdriver in this series specifically for that purpose a year prior. Then I saw people using these impact drivers on YouTube videos and decided I must get one. It was money well spent. My hands and wrists hurt much less. Plus, the screws sink right in. It's amazing. I and sticking with DeWalt so I can save on battery expenses. They are not cheap. I do not like what they charge for them.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Stone

customer_reviews.title: Dead
customer_reviews.text: My drill just started smoking without any lode on it. This drill is practically new. I have other DeWalt drills with no problems. Can you give me advice what to do with it.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Dottery

customer_reviews.title: Good for the home gamer
customer_reviews.text: As a home gamer, this impact driver works well. Great for taking out the bots for the mower blades on the mower deck. Don't even have to block the blades so they don't spin. Bought some socket adapters and use it while working on the car. Used to to take some rusty screws out of the threshold in the doorway and it actually broke the phillips bit. Probably a cheap bit, but who knows. There are 3 LED lights at the base of the chuck and they cast a perfect 3 way shadow of the bit right over the screw your going for, minor annoyance, but still better than holding the flashlight in your teeth and reefing on the driver.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Turner

customer_reviews.title: Wife reviews husbands drill
customer_reviews.text: As usual dewalt produces solid products. Just replace a 5 Plus years old dewalt drill. Been wanting an upgrade since the newer one has more power, the drill and battery are smaller and compact. I bought this here on amazon bc it was cheaper than Lowe’s and Home Depot. Plus side...comes with a sturdy bag if you buy from the big box store it does not come with a bag. The bag is way better than those big bulky plastic cases. Overall, I’m happy about this upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Hedi

customer_reviews.title: My First Impact Driver
customer_reviews.text: My first impact driver. Went to work & found two of my coworkers using this same DW. Tried it & got sold. Made in USA! Bought the DCF885C2, it comes with extra battery, belt hook & hard case, not soft bag.
customer_reviews.author: Marie Grace Limjuco Sumaya

customer_reviews.title: Great product but better deal elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Bought during Prime day, immediately after Prime ended the sale price was the normal price. I returned and bought a kit from Lowes with an extra battery as well as a drill for $28 more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: Magnetic bit hold broke with very little use. Was not dropped.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only complaint would be that there is not battery indicator
customer_reviews.text: I purchased to use for putting longs screws into some 6x6 posts. It has plenty of power and performs great as a drill as well as a drill/driver. I purchased the socket adapters also to use for light jobs where my regular impact would be too powerful. I expect this will be a very handy tool in the long run. My only negative, which didn't cost it any stars, is that the battery does not have an indicator showing the charge status. I'll likely buy additional batteries which will have the indicators later.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D. Estes

customer_reviews.title: broke after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: So, I just started using this driver a few days ago. Worked only for a short while. Now it won't hold any bit inserted into it. Just falls out. Unfortunately I had bought this item over a month back in anticipation of needing it to do some deck work this summer, but didn't start using it until this week. Now it's too late for me to send back and I'm stuck with an unusable impact driver. Super lame. If anyone out there knows whether or not this can be fixed I would love to hear. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Alfred J. Kober

customer_reviews.title: It's the batteries that sold the deal
customer_reviews.text: Having used an 18V that my neighbor had-I knew that I needed one with more torque than my line run 20v drill driver(with no impact).After digging around in the comments-I found that this baby uses the same batteries as my drill-driver. Moments after delivery-I snapped in an old(but charged)20v batt and put it to work.Dewalt-why didn't you say that up front?Anyway,I've got 3 20v. batts and 2 chargers.Couldn't be happier. PS-beware-this thing has a ton of torque and can snap screw heads if you really juice it up!!
customer_reviews.author: The Boss

customer_reviews.title: It's a Impact Driver -
customer_reviews.text: What could I say other than 1. It's the Dewalt Brand 2. It's an impact driver 3. It uses the same battery as my drills I purchased this because I do woodworking and I got tired of stripping screws when trying to tighten a screw. This won't necessarily prevent it but it will make it much easier to drive a screw in and 9 times out of 10 it does it without stripping the screw head. The compact size is also nice, giving me more clearance than my drills for tight spots but that wasn't my reason for the purchase. I'm very happy with it and if Dewalt continues to make good quality products I'll continue to use them.
customer_reviews.author: medina4me

customer_reviews.title: Little monster
customer_reviews.text: I needed a drill and a impact wrench for car. Bought this. Works well enough. Can do both tasks of drilling and taking out nuts if you have attachments. I wouldn't use on lug nuts doesn't have that kind of power but can make taking them out faster if you loose them with a breaker bar first. Pretty neat little thing would recommend if you need drilling and taking out nuts occasionally. Good for weekend warrior.
customer_reviews.author: Julio Lizarraga

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine helped me on a home improvement project and used my 18V Dewalt driver when his drill gave out. He was really impressed with the light weight, balance, and driving power of my driver. I bought this for for his birthday, and he has already used it on a couple of projects. He loves it. It is the perfect gift for your handy man. Couple it with a Dewalt driver bit kit for the icing on the cake.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: Drill
customer_reviews.text: The drill works great but the smaller 20V battery only last about 3 hours. If you are going to get this impact drill make sure the manufacture doesn't pawn off the smaller version of the 20V battery on you.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Returned Product
customer_reviews.text: Craftsman has a much better deal...you can purchase a driver drill and impact drill for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great beginner Dewalt Impact Drill
customer_reviews.text: Great device works like a charm. Wish the battery contained more of a charge inbetween uses but for the price this was expected and I can always upgrade to a larger battery in the future. The 3 LED lights on the front of the drill are great for illuminating what your working on. The Hog Nose release system works great for switching bits on the fly as well. All in all this was a good purchase and would do so again as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Mort

customer_reviews.title: Good Deal
customer_reviews.text: I thought the price was good and that and the DeWalt name sold me. I haven't used it much yet but it will be used a lot in the future. One thing that bothers me about DeWalt tools and some others is that they have a picture of an American flag on front of the box leading us to believe that this is an American made product, but in the fine print it says made with globally sourced parts, i.e. parts could come from anywhere, including China. Other tool manufacturers are doing the same thing. I don't think everything from China is necessarily poor quality, but I think the American flag on the DeWalt package is misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Chanlesa

customer_reviews.title: I wish I Knew About These Sooner
customer_reviews.text: Im a very amateur wood worker and handy man. If you could even call it that. But I've always loved tools since childhood and love trying to fix and/or build stuff. I have never really knew the difference between having a cordless drill with a screwdriver attachment and an impact driver. Now I know. This thing is great. It doesn't break a sweat, ever (again, just a weekend warrior here). Dewalt makes a great product at a reasonable price. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Corey Hightower

customer_reviews.title: found out a piece on or in the frount is missing
customer_reviews.text: i had t o redue this reiew, i i have learned on mine a ring that hold the dills in place is gone,,,it runs fine although cant dependqs
customer_reviews.author: ANTHONY TELLS THE WAY IT IS AFTER USEING  GOOD OR BAD

customer_reviews.title: Handy, light
customer_reviews.text: Nice and light small driver. This is my fourth Dewalt cordless drill. I like Dewalt brand drills. Very sturdy and well made. The only negative is that this drill kit came with only one battery. NOT GOOD!! I therefore ordered a second Dewalt battery for this drill. Later on, the batteries become unaffordable if you want to stick to the Dewalt brand. SO, I ended up spending $145 for the drill kit and a second battery.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. It was my mistake. I was looking at several and thought this was the brushless. It has brushes. Battery life is poor. Work with it for about a hour and it dies. It will hold a charge for several days without being used but dies quickly under load. No fuel gauge. It charges fairly quick but the purchase price of a additional battery is steep. I recommend spending a little more and getting brushless with 2 batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Felix roebuck

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.text: I love this impact driver. It's so fun. I wish I had more projects for this at home. I'm a novice. Anyway, I put down flooring in my ceiling with this, and I installed some studs and a large bathroom fan. This thing places long screws into 40yr old ceiling joists like butter. Love it to death! Let's hope that's not a premonition.
customer_reviews.author: DudeFromChicago

customer_reviews.title: light and powerful 20V
customer_reviews.text: I have another Dewalt 20v impact driver without the three lights in the front. I only bought this model because of its dependable, lightweight, 20v, and the three lights in the front. When I opened the package I noticed the cheap plastic construction instead of the metal frame in my older model. it works but I have to be careful not to drop it in fear of the plastic breaking. Sadly, Dewalt is cutting corners and giving us cheap construction at a higher price.
customer_reviews.author: hernam13

customer_reviews.title: don't build a deck without one
customer_reviews.text: I was planning to build a deck with my drill and then a friend told me about impact drivers so I bought this one. It was fantastic. It drove 3 inch deck screws into wood 2x6s with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Best drill I own!
customer_reviews.text: Man do I love this impact drill!! I love the LEDs (thought they were just eye candy -- but they're super helpful!). I love how light it is, yet it's also super powerful and the battery lasts a long time. I have 2 18V drills that I use at the same time as this impact drill and I can get through 2-3 charges on my 18V drills with this 20V impact drill. Wish I could just replace all my drills with 20V models.
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: More capable than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical if this would work for me. At 110 ft/lbs max it's not a real impact wrench. But it was able to do lug nuts with some protest. From what I know they Were torqued to spec which is slightly more than 110ft/lbs so 🤷‍♂️. Edit : some other bolts that were torqued harder kinda laughed at it. But still 5 stars because it did more than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: three_legs

customer_reviews.title: Seems refurbished!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this item. My husband has been using Dewalt for years and never had an issue. We had to purchase a new one since his previous one got lost at work. It arrived yesterday, the light doesn’t work, it doesn’t have much power and it’s scratched. I think these item was refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great impact driver
customer_reviews.text: Combined this with a purchase of the battery powered wet/dry vac, and it's a great combo. A battery powered vac will not have the same suction as a 120 VAC one, but it's still very good. The driver is super - very powerful and the light weight battery makes it very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hal

customer_reviews.title: Don’t know how I went this long without it!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is powerful! I don’t know how I went this long without one. Only thing I don’t like, is that I had to buy all new drill bits. But it was totally worth the investment. Battery isn’t the best/longest lasting by any means. But I can get 4-6 hours out of a battery with constant use. The charger is a quick recharge and 30 min and battery is ready to go again. I would recommend buying an extra battery.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce Cheramie

customer_reviews.title: Works well and plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool a lot and am very happy with it. I've had it about two years and it been very good. The battery charge last pretty long and I don't have to charge it in a single days use. If fact I go weeks sometimes with light use. Easy to change bits fast too and it holds them securely with the pull down to release chuck!
customer_reviews.author: H. wrightTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Use it once and you'll never go back-- to Cordless drill motors
customer_reviews.text: Bright leds in front for seeing your work. Tool is powerful for bolt install and removal. Small impacts are the ONLY decent way to install longer drywall screws in oak or if longer than a couple of inches long. It will remove drywall screws that a drill motor (even variable speed) can't begin to get out without camming out. They're so handy when I lost my 3rd small impact I keep in the house that I bought this one to replace it so I would still have 3 cordless impacts of the 1/4" size.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Thoms

customer_reviews.title: strange little gun.
customer_reviews.text: my last electric hammer drill had a switch to turn off the hammer, this does not. Needed to drive in drywall screws with it and could not. Might work better with tiny bolts.
customer_reviews.author: doug huebner

customer_reviews.title: light wt. and powerful
customer_reviews.text: i love dewalt tools... this is the third addition to my drill collection... it's light wt. and powerful... it does take a different type of battery than all my other ones but it last a long time
customer_reviews.author: yinn2yangTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: Quality Suspect !! Battery provided does not charge
customer_reviews.text: I am wondering about the quality of Dewalt from Amazon. The battey with this new unit does not charge. I am sending just the battery back. I am not sure how they are going to handle this return. Should be interesting. The charger provided does work because it charges other batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt is the best
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt is the epitome of top quality tools, truly best on the market. The reality is you buy a tool such as an impact driver once every 10years or more, you might as well pay the premium because the improvement over some of the lower tier brands that are $50 dollars or so cheaper is night and day. It is lightweight, compact. has so much power that it can do most home improvement projects, and the LED light is fantastic addition that should be standard on every tool. Only complaint is that battery isn't too long (I get about 8hours before it starts to fade) but it will still get you through most days without slowing down.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey D

customer_reviews.title: Time efficient. No need to work hard. Lol
customer_reviews.text: Portable as fudge!!!! I love it. decreased my time of removing lugs and this secures it even more by using more torque. Well spent $$$ in my books. I let me neighbors and friends borrow and they love it. Really useful. Make sure you charge it.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaDawn

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt 20 Max Impact Driver
customer_reviews.text: I bought this years too late. It's like a regular screw gun or drill on steroids. The 1/4 drive is perfect for household use. Far lighter and more maneuverable than my Dewalt regular screw gun/ drill. Very reasonably priced at $99.00. I'll probably get a 1/2" drive later for my work.
customer_reviews.author: Mylo Mylo

customer_reviews.title: Recently upgraded to this bad boy and have absolutely loved it
customer_reviews.text: Recently upgraded to this bad boy and have absolutely loved it. Bought this to do some minor renovations around the house and haven't had any issues with it yet. Powerful, easy to grip, and easy to change out bits. Only negative though is that one battery isn't enough for bigger projects so I find myself having to constantly charge it. A second battery would address that though.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jay

customer_reviews.title: Peace in work
customer_reviews.text: A well made impact driver that deliver sufficient power to me in my woodworking projects. It is light in wight but strong enough to withstand rough handling. Battery provides steady power in extended use and the LEDs are really helpful for increased accuracy. Recommended for home and professional workers who are looking for peace at work.
customer_reviews.author: Wijendra Gunatilake

customer_reviews.title: Great deal
customer_reviews.text: Just want to give a huge shout out to amazon for matching deals!! I seen this set on sale at Lowe’s for Father’s Day they were out of stock. The deal was $99. I checked amazon and there it was for the same deal! This product speaks for itself as far as quality goes. My husband has no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have lots of DeWalt cordless tools and they always perform. This one is no different. True there is a newer brushless model but this is all I need and saved $30.00 over any local big box store.
customer_reviews.author: HOMESAVER

customer_reviews.title: This is a hobby driver
customer_reviews.text: This is not the brushless unit. It works fine but will never handle the speed of house framing. Heats up very fast. Cones with the smallest battery and slower charger. If you are a hobbies or home handyman this will never be an issue for you but I would avoid if you are building.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Battery is limited but great drill
customer_reviews.text: This drill is actually pretty good for the price. The pro about this is that there are three lights that eliminate the work area. Very nice. The battery tho is not that great. 20 min run time if used a lot. I use larger batteries 5 amp and up and the drill works forever.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for small projects
customer_reviews.text: Works great for small projects around the house or tinkering with smaller bolts // nuts. If you’re looking to take off car tires or anything larger, this is not the drill for you. I love this drill and it’s always nice to have a variety of drills for different jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Missing Belt Clip-False advertising on pictures.
customer_reviews.text: This a great tool, bought it for my husband to use for work. I didn't give it 5 stars because the advertising in Spanish states that the belt clip isincluded, but it is not. Be prepared to purchase a belt clip separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough as nails...
customer_reviews.text: I love DeWalt tools. They are moderately priced, work well and last far longer then i ever thought they would. I purchased these as throw aways when they wore out, still waiting for that to happen. dropped, banged, run dead, recharged, back to work... I now have the full line, still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: LowJack

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty power!
customer_reviews.text: Great impact driver! I used it to remove shelving with a few dozen long screws into studs in my garage and it easily turned them all out. It's lightweight and the light is a feature I will never do without again.
customer_reviews.author: k9

customer_reviews.title: Contractor Approved
customer_reviews.text: First Job: When my metal fabricator came over to install some steel railings, his 20vMax DeWalt Impact driver was low on battery. I simply broke out this bad boy and we were able to finish the job without any delay. Looking forward to many more years of having this tool in my arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment!
customer_reviews.text: The last drill I wanted to guy because it's a tad bit more expensive that the other companies but after receiving this I realized that this is a product you really want to get. The drill works perfect and is really a beauty because you can control the speed very easily and the impact works spot on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery life could use some help, everything else is great!
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is a little less than I was hoping. However, we run this tool pretty hard. It doesn't really get a break between screws and the screws are 6, 8, and 10 inches long. So, to be fair, it does have to work pretty hard. We have 4 of these tools with 8 batteries, so with that, we can go all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Amberly

customer_reviews.title: a must need tool
customer_reviews.text: i ended up getting this when it was on sale. i'm sure glad i did. i've already used this on many projects and i'll never drive a screw without an impact driver again in my life. so much easier and more control.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Came as a recommendation from a friend and I couldn’t be happier. My favorite tool in my toolbox
customer_reviews.author: Grant H.

customer_reviews.title: Packaging was horrible.  Product great.
customer_reviews.text: I have other Dewalt drills. This impact driver is the best. Ordered the impact driver bit pack too. That was a heck of a deal. The only complaint I have is the packaging. It sucked. This the second delivery that looks like it was thrown off the truck. The box was crushed and packing tape was almost torn apart. The previous order had several damaged items.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Brees

customer_reviews.title: Battery no good
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money cause the battery don’t last long
customer_reviews.author: Ernest G.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing this is my go to for just everything it can even take my lug nuts off my SUV with ease and it was a great price
customer_reviews.author: Tyler H.

customer_reviews.title: More power and way cheaper than snap on screwgun/ impact driver
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my 7.2v snap on screwgun with this and I love it! Great power and is far cheaper than the new snap on 14.4v. No clutch but use common sense, no problems so far. Led lights and a welcome feature for removing dashes for airbag replacements on subaru vehicles. Nothing but praise so far
customer_reviews.author: Cory Houser

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to my Dewalt collection
customer_reviews.text: After years of driving screws with drills, I finally purchased an impact driver for a home reno project with lots of drywall installation. Not sure what took me so long to get a driver. It's great having a drill setup with the bit and easily grab the driver to screw the fastener. No complaints about the Dewalt batteries. I often use a Max XR battery in this driver for extra capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Ballard

customer_reviews.title: BATTERY DON'T WORK!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in this purchase because the battery was not fully functional it won't hold a proper charge. The battery depletes in less than five (5) minutes. PURE GARBAGE!!! I worked for that money i spent and expected a decent transaction...
customer_reviews.author: Irvin Simmons Jr

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting durable drill
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed this drill to build two porches. The drill would last all day long and made my job easier. I love how strong this drill is.
customer_reviews.author: JayeVV

customer_reviews.title: Has done more then I thought it would
customer_reviews.text: Removed paint and rust from truck body panels, took off bolts form shocks, done brake jobs and a lot of other automotive related stuff. Making theses jobs go so much quicker then if I was using just hand tools.
customer_reviews.author: Parker Hilbert

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt you know it's awesome 5⭐'s 👍's up
customer_reviews.text: This thing is compact and bad ass just got it Works great Not sure about battery life though haven't used it that much has led lights that come on when you pull the trigger So you can see what you're doing
customer_reviews.author: Brian parshall

customer_reviews.title: Watch the small print
customer_reviews.text: Price is great. I gave a good review on the one I sent back by mistake. That one wasn’t a good buy. Misleading if u don’t read the small print that it’s tool only. This one is the good 1
customer_reviews.author: Eric Bitzer

customer_reviews.title: I love it, the best price anywhere
customer_reviews.text: it got here so fast, I love it, the best price anywhere, I have been playing with it for days, it is so cool. I have another cordless, red and black, no name dropping. but this makes it work like a toy. thank you so much. Susan
customer_reviews.author: Susan R. Milner

customer_reviews.title: Great update from drill for screwing
customer_reviews.text: Didn't realize how much better these units work for screws than traditional drill. Great deal less stripping, and a lot lighter to hold for periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: This impact will be your new favourite tool
customer_reviews.text: My favorite tool for any job. It’s has an endless list of attachments that allow it to be used to almost any project. The design allows you to push down when driving screws and effortlessly transfer force without stripping or jumping off screw head.
customer_reviews.author: matt karl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: WOW. Ton's of torque, drives long screws through thick wood stack-ups like they were warm butter. Just make sure to use screws with the torx screwhead (made in all sizes) or you won't go very far. An impact driver is a tool high torque, high rpm tool and a Philips or slotted head fastener simple wasn't designed for it. Using one and the impact tool will bump out/slip out constantly. Use a high-torque compatible screw head and you'll be as impressed as I have been from this incredible tool.
customer_reviews.author: Dan V.

customer_reviews.title: Battery does not have charge level indication.
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of dewalt products. I bought this to replace the impact I lost. No complaints, the dewalt 1/4” impact is one of my most used power tools behind the 5” Dewalt 20v orbital sander. The only slight negative is the battery that it comes with does not have the charge level indication lights like all the other batteries I received with my Dewalt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my in home jobs
customer_reviews.text: perfect for my in home jobs, IE mounting TV's etc...I'm not building homes with this thing but more than powerful enough to put screws through metal studs.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Rothenberg

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I use this tool everyday for work along with other deWalt power tools. Powerful and batteries last for lots of driving. To be fair I use this and abuse dropped mine several times and they keep on going.. things that need improving is the keeper for the bits wears out and triggers go bad and motors do go bad.. but like I say.. I use this everyday and buy a new one every year. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Rush

customer_reviews.title: Starting investment into DeWalt cordless system
customer_reviews.text: Quality entry level DeWalt system for occasional handyman at home! It's east to operate around the house yet powerful enough to drive a 3inch screen into the 2by4.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Quality DeWalt Impact
customer_reviews.text: I love this little workhorse! It was the only drill I had on a job to build a whole room! (Ok, I also had a floor impact drill, but just for the floor..)
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: What can you say, Its a dewalt. This thing is great been using my drill as a driver the whole time. What was I thinking. The only disappointment is the battery. I charge it full charge, let it sit over night and the next morning its dead. Doesn't matter what I do take it out of the tool or leave it in still dead after 24 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt
customer_reviews.text: There’s a reason why most if not all the Contractors I’ve seen use Dewalt. It’s the best in my mind. Made in USA, well that’s the icing and cherry

product_meta.title: DEWALT 20V MAX Impact Driver Kit, 1/4-Inch (DCF885C1)
product_meta.description: The DEWALT DCF885C1 20V max* 1/4" impact driver kit features a compact (5.55" front to back), lightweight (2.8 lbs) design which fits into tight areas. It has 3 LEDs with 20-second delay after trigger release to provide visibility without shadows. This driver offers one-handed loading with a 1/4" Hex chuck that accepts 1" bit tips. Specs: max torque: 1400.0 in-lbs, no-load speed: 0-2,800, impacts/min: 0-3,200 IPM, 1/4"qr Hex drive. Backed by DEWALT 3 year limited warranty. Kit includes: (1) DCF885 impact driver, (1) 20V max* battery (1.5 Ah), (1) fast charger.
